meanings.definition: A small, peg-like structure on a fungus where spores are produced.
meanings.sent1: The sterigmatum on the fungus released tiny spores.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the sterigmatum to understand spore production.
meanings.sent3: The sterigmatum on the mushroom seemed to be dancing in the wind.
meanings.sent4: Each sterigmatum was like a tiny factory producing spores.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the sterigmatum looked like a miniature tower of spore creation.

meanings.definition: The stalk of a sporangium in certain fungi.
meanings.sent1: The sterigmatum held the sporangium firmly in place.
meanings.sent2: The sterigmatum was long and slender, supporting the sporangium.
meanings.sent3: The sterigmatum was so tall, it reached the top of the fungal kingdom!
meanings.sent4: In the world of fungi, the sterigmatum was the strong backbone of spore production.
meanings.sent5: The sterigmatum stood proudly, like a guardian protecting the sporangium within.
